snippet: Outside experts familiar with the talks expressed doubt that Pakistan was willing to curb what it regards as its only real defense against India.

byline.contributor: William J. Broad contributed reporting from New York, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis from Washington.

abstract: American officials are negotiating with Pakistan on limiting its nuclear arsenal, amid fears it might deploy small hard-to-secure tactical weapon; skeptics doubt Pakistan would curb its program, which proliferation experts consider world's most dangerous.

keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Outside experts familiar with the talks expressed doubt that Pakistan was willing to curb what it regards as its only real defense against India.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Exploring a Deal to Limit the Scope of Pakistan’s Nuclear Arsenal
headline.main: U.S. Exploring Deal to Limit Pakistan’s Nuclear Arsenal
